articles.description: Ollie Pope repaid England's faith with his best hundred in a home Test, writes Stephan Shemilt.
articles.title: England v India: Ollie Pope repays faith with hundred at Headingley

articles.description: England show fight to beat Spain and reach the European Under-21 Championship semi-finals, now can Lee Carsley's side defend their title?
articles.title: England Under-21s: Fighting spirit lifts England Under-21s as they eye more history at Euro 2025

articles.description: Jobe Bellingham's first goal for Borussia Dortmund mirrors his brother Jude's start to life at the Bundesliga club, and fuels more comparisons between the siblings.
articles.title: Club World Cup: Jobe Bellingham says 'I always practise that' after fuelling Jude comparisons with first Dortmund goal

articles.description: Former Scotland captain and British and Irish Lions great Ian McLauchlan has died at the age of 83.
articles.title: Ian McLauchlan: Scotland & British and Irish Lions great dies at 83

articles.description: Steve Borthwick's England XV conceded two late tries and had Immanuel Feyi-Waboso sent off as they were beaten 26-24 by a France XV in a dramatic non-capped match at Twickenham's Allianz Stadium.
articles.title: England XV 24-26 France XV: Steve Borthwick's beaten by late French try in dramatic match

articles.description: Marc Guehi is ready to see out the final year of his contract at Crystal Palace if a move to Liverpool does not materialise, while Marcus Rashford remains hopeful of joining Barcelona.
articles.title: Football gossip: Guehi, Rashford, Rodrygo, Jackson, Onana, Williams, Sancho, McTominay

articles.description: Ukrainian Dayana Yastremska and American McCartney Kessler reach the women's singles final at Nottingham.
articles.title: Nottingham Open 2025: Dayana Yastremska & McCartney Kessler in final

articles.description: British flyweight Galal Yafai's world title ambitions suffer a major setback in a shock points loss to Francisco Rodriguez Jr in Birmingham.
articles.title: Yafai vs Rodriguez Jr: British flyweight dropped in shock points loss

articles.description: Inter Milan keep their hopes of winning the Club World Cup alive by coming from behind to snatch a late win against Urawa Red Diamonds in Seattle.
articles.title: Inter Milan 2-1 Urawa Reds: Inter snatch late win against stubborn Urawa

articles.description: England's Tommy Fleetwood will take a three-shot lead into the final round of the Travelers Championship.
articles.title: Tommy Fleetwood takes lead in hunt for maiden PGA Tour title
